definition: to drag/to tow/to trail/to hang down/to mop (the floor)/to delay/to drag on
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise

sentences.english: Fasten towing line on towing bitts.
sentences.chinese: 把拖带系缆桩上拖缆绑牢。

sentences.english: There is a vessel with a difficult tow on passage to Eekhavn now approaching Pelican Bank buoy.
sentences.chinese: 有一艘多拖带船正驶向爱克号已至皮乐肯岸浮标。

sentences.english: On weekends, Adele says, “we schlepped the kids to rallies.
sentences.chinese: 阿黛尔说周末“我们拖带着孩子去集会。”

sentences.english: To The farmer had to drag the unwilling cow into the field.
sentences.chinese: 农夫把牛连拖带拉硬弄到农场。

sentences.english: A. Abandon the towing vessel. B. Radio for emergency assistance. C.
sentences.chinese: 一艘远洋拖带船正在深水中下沉。

sentences.english: On weekends, Adele says, “we schlepped the kids to rallies.”
sentences.chinese: 阿黛尔说周末“我们拖带着孩子去集会。”

definition: (idiom) with everyone lending a hand (eagerly but somewhat chaotically)
to drag sb along against his will/to draw a forced analogy
to bind a person's upper body, with arms tied behind the back and rope looped around the neck/to truss up
